info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 4:29AM CDT until June 17 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CALHOUN...JERSEY...ST. CHARLES...LINCOLN... NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN...EAST CENTRAL OSAGE...WARREN AND NORTHERN GASCONADE COUNTIES... At 429 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Old Kane to near Winfield to near Treloar, moving east at 80 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... O`Fallon, St. Charles, St. Peters, Chesterfield, Wentzville, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Lake St. Louis, Washington, Bridgeton, Dardenne Prairie, Troy, Jerseyville, Warrenton, Weldon Spring, Wright City, Cottleville, Hermann, New Haven and Elsberry. This also includes Cuivre River State Park, First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site, and Pere Marquette State Park. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 188 and 229. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
